message.content: This question requires knowledge of the lunar cycle and how long it takes for the moon to go through its phases. A full moon occurs approximately every 29.5 days, so the boy would need to wait a month in order to see another full moon. Option (A) is incorrect because a week is too short of a time period for the moon to go through its phases. Option (B) is also incorrect because a day is too short for the moon to change from full to a different phase. Option (C) is incorrect because a fortnight is only 14 days, which is also too short for the moon to go through its phases.

Option (B) is incorrect because a day is too short for another full moon to occur.
